article: A man was exploring caves by the seashore when he found a bag with a bunch of hardened clay balls.It was like someone had  _  the balls and left them out in the sun to bake. They didn't look like much, but they  _  the man, so he took the bag out of the cave with him.As he walked along the beach, he  _  the clay balls one at a time out into the ocean as far as he could.He thought little about it  _  he dropped one of the clay balls and it cracked open on a rock.Inside was a beautiful, precious stone!  _  , the man started breaking open the  _  balls.Each contained a similar treasure.He found thousands of dollars'  _  of jewels in the 20 or so leftover ones. It's like that  _  people.We look at someone, maybe even ourselves, but we  _  see the clay shell.It doesn't look like much from the  _  .It isn't always beautiful or shining, so we  _  it.We see that person as less important than someone more  _  or stylish or well known or wealthy.But we haven't taken the time to find the treasure  _  inside that person.
